group_1.narration: Yachiyo, after being forced to relive@our deaths, decided even more firmly that@she had been responsible for them.@She even decided to disband her new team.
But we never thought for a moment@that we died because of her!@And she shoudn't think so either!
We both chose our own fates...
So we had to tell her, no matter what!
Though that was much easier said than done.

group_1.textRight: Yeah... I could only knock a rice bowl@over.

group_1.textLeft: I don't think anyone would understand what@message that was trying to send.

group_1.textRight: We could get a knife and drop it right in@front of Yachiyo!
That'd say, "We want you to cut yourself@free from the past!"

group_1.textLeft: Mm...that just sounds like something out of@a horror movie.

group_1.textRight: I wish we had a pen or something we could@scribble a message down with.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, ghosts don't have enough power to@pick one up and write with it.
We might manage to get as far as lifting it@up, but writing letters?

group_1.textRight: Who thought getting a message out would be@this tricky?
These things were so easy when I was alive...

group_1.narration: We puzzled over ways to contact her@with no luck...
It was all because Iroha Tamaki@managed to convince her!

group_1.textRight: Will you give yourself one more chance?

group_1.narration: In those vital last moments before@their team would disappear forever...@She got Yachiyo to take another good look@at herself, and made her reconsider!
We wanted to use this opportunity@to find some way to let Yachiyo know@how we felt...
And Kanae thought of something@that might work!
